meanings.definition: The act of applying color to something.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the clouring of her drawings with bright markers.
meanings.sent2: The clouring of the walls in different shades made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent3: The clouring of the cupcakes made them look like tiny rainbows.
meanings.sent4: The clouring of the sky at sunset painted the horizon in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: His clouring of the map helped him remember the different regions vividly.

meanings.definition: The appearance of something as a result of the colors used on it.
meanings.sent1: The clouring of the dress made it stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The clouring of the flowers in the garden was vibrant and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The clouring of the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The clouring of the leaves in autumn creates a stunning natural palette.
meanings.sent5: The clouring of the sunset painted the sky in shades of red and gold.

meanings.definition: A substance used to add color to something.
meanings.sent1: She bought new clouring for her painting project.
meanings.sent2: The clouring for the Easter eggs was bright and cheerful.
meanings.sent3: The clouring for the icing was a surprise mix of colors.
meanings.sent4: The clouring for the fabric dye was carefully measured for the perfect shade.
meanings.sent5: The clouring for the car paint was a custom blend of metallic hues.
